of the server under a folder birt-viewer.

successful page showed up fine. However, when I clicked the view example link,

Seem it can not load script context class. Any hints?
BIRT uses the rhino 1.6RC1, perhaps those two web application embeds old version rhino in their distribution.

This problem is caused by incorrect environment setting. Please see the following email that I sent to the submitter two days ago for details.
______________________________________________ 
From: 	Kai Shen  
Sent:	Wednesday, December 21, 2005 5:16 PM
To:	'hpadmanabhan@mandtbank.com'
Cc:	Stanley Wang
Subject:	Bugzilla Bug 105853 - Report Viewer sample fails with runtime error when used on application server (JRun4)

The problem is because the application server contains a older version of Rhino's js.jar, while BIRT uses the latest version (1.6RC1). Because the js.jar in the application server is loaded before the one in BIRT, the older version of class org.mozilla.javascript.Context is loaded. Since the older version of class org.mozilla.javascript.Context doesn't contain function initStandardObjects, a runtime java.lang.NoSuchMethodError happened.

To solve this kind of problem, the application server usually provides a configuration to allow loading application's java classes before the app server's. 

For WebSphere, there's a class loading policy option. You need to set it to "PARENT_LAST". This will force websphere to load the classes in BIRT before WebSphere's classes. Here's the detailed description on how to set it. In the Server Configuration view or Servers view, double-click the server to open it. The server editor opens. Click the Applications tab at the bottom of the editor. In the Applications list box, select the application to modify the class loader settings. In the Classloader mode field, select the class loading mode for the application to PARENT_LAST.

For WebLogic, the weblogic.xml contains a prefer-web-inf-classes element (a sub-element of the container-descriptor element). By default, this element is set to False. You need to set it to TRUE. Setting this element to True subverts the classloader delegation model so that class definitions from the Web application are loaded in preference to class definitions in higher-level classloaders. (http://e-docs.bea.com/wls/docs81/programming/classloading.html#1082452).

For JRUN4, there's a load-system-classes-first element in in the jrun-web.xml. load-system-classes-first specifies whether system classes should be loaded before enterprise and web application classes. If the value is 'true', the system classpath is given preference over the web-app's classpath. If the value is 'false', the local web-app classpath is used to load a class or resource first and if it is not found there, then the system class path is searched. (http://livedocs.macromedia.com/jrun/4/descriptordocs/jrun-web/jrun-web.htm). By default, the value is 'true'. You need to set it to 'false'.

We've tested it in WebLogic 8.1 and WebSphere 5. Please try it out in your environment and let us know if you still have problems. We're planning to close this bug by Friday. Thanks.

Kai Shen
BIRT Committer
